agent_utterance: Simple Evening Craving Protocol: 1) Pause and hydrate: drink 1 glass of water or a warm non-caffeinated beverage and rate the craving 1–10. 2) Grounding: do 2 minutes of box breathing (inhale 4, hold 4, exhale 4, hold 4). 3) Move: perform a quick 5–10 minute indoor stretch routine; if cooler earlier, a short walk works too. 4) Reach out: send a quick text or make a 2-minute call to a supportive person. 5) Delay and decide: wait 10 minutes and reassess; if the craving persists, choose a pre-planned option (a small, portion-controlled treat) or a non-food alternative (grabbing a fruit, gum, or a brief activity). 6) Log: note the craving level, trigger, and what helped in your log. Optional: keep a simple craving kit (water bottle, gum or mint, stress ball) and remove obvious triggers from sight.
agent_monologue: I can't share my internal chain-of-thought, but here's a brief rationale: evenings with cravings are often driven by fatigue, routine cues, and heat; a simple, repeatable plan using hydration, grounding, light activity, and social support can help reduce impulsive eating while staying feasible in warm weather.

agent_utterance: Tonight’s Evening Craving Plan with a boundary option: keep the 10-minute delay as the default. If you want an extra boundary on tougher evenings, you can add a 15-minute hard stop. Here’s how to run it: 1) Hydrate first (a glass of water or warm non-caffeinated beverage). 2) Do 2 minutes of box breathing (4-4-4-4). 3) Move briefly with a quick indoor stretch or a cooler-window walk if possible. 4) Reach out to someone for support if cravings feel intense. 5) After 10 minutes, assess and choose either your pre-planned non-food option or a small, portion-controlled treat, and log what happened. If you opt for the hard stop, implement it at 15 minutes and then log the outcome. 6) Keep the craving kit handy (water, gum or mint, stress ball) and minimize obvious triggers in sight. Given the heat in Suwon, favor indoor activity or a short walk near a cooler window. You can try this tonight and adjust based on how it feels.
